title: A Graphic Cardano Knowledge Corpus
description: Human language (text or speech) is varied, nuanced, & not the optimal exclusive medium for learning complex systems, concepts, or processes.

f6_assessments.q0: This could create a great resource on Cardano outside the major languages. It would be good to have an understanding of how accurate the process would be on what can be quite a technical subject. Is this accuracy further impacted when going to concise infographics? Small changes in meaning could have a large impact in this case and make the infographic hard to follow. More information of which topics will be covered by the project would be useful.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has good experience in the machine translation field, though it would be good to have some reference to back this up (such as a linked-in page) as this is a niche field and vital for the successful deliver of the project. 
Whilst there is a detailed timeline, it would be good to have more information on the quantity and focus of the content to be delivered.
The proposer appears to be creating the content then apply machine translation. This raises the question on why use OCR? If you have the source information, would it not be less error prone to apply the translation to the direct text fragments?
It would also be great to see a marketing plan. How will the 58 languages this if created for know it exists?
f6_assessments.q2: There is a reasonably detailed plan, however apart from the number of languages to be translated, there are no deliverables around the number of infographics to actually be delivered. This would  be required to audit progress. What does success look like for this project? How many views in total, per language? It would also be good to have some metrics on accuracy of the translation, even if this is only done by random sampling.

f6_assessments.q0: It's true, that in this modern world, people are more attracted to attractive web apps. And this proposal also addresses multi language needs using machine translations. It would be great for global audience.
f6_assessments.q1: Budgeting and the project timeline is quite clear. The problem is with the other contributors. How can the proposer make sure that the community will be attracted to contribute after Public Beta Release. Of course, the engine will likely to be successfully made. But the adoption needs more detail explanation.
f6_assessments.q2: KPI & project timeline are explained well there. But the progress could be tracked by the community after public beta release. How can the proposer make sure that it's easily auditable by the auditor/community?

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer identifies an original and broader approach to this challenge, noting that the over-reliance on text is limiting adoption and solution.  The argument that development and curation of a "corpus of graphics and diagrams that illustrate how blockchains esp. Cardano works", if adopted by the community, could help rapidly increase worldwide adoption seems justified, especially contrasted to approaches which "only address the Cardano non-English gap one language at a time".  Missing for me was more clarity on how the proposer aims to ensure adoption to make this impactful and a clearer explanation of how they envision its place in the eco-system.  In addition, more cited evidence that this solution really is better than domain/cultural-specific solutions may be needed.  Given the evidence, I regard this as moderately addressing the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: While the qualifications noted seem relevant to the solution (PhD Learning Technologies, teaching Natural Language, developer experience), more information on the proposer (eg links to professional sites) would be helpful in making an assessment.  Proposal could have benefited from more examples as well as some proof of evidence for the assertions (eg the intuitive-sounding "[text is] not the optimal exclusive medium for learning complex systems" is not sourced.  Additionally, the project seems complex enough as to probably require more of a team, and no information, evidence or acknowledgement is offered on this or plans for this - especially regarding the more "business" end.  Being somewhat similar to the proposer, I am aware of my own limitations in these fields and would feel it is more appropriate to make these explicit.  Difficult to assess likelihood of success without further details about how it is planned to be integrated into the community: the given plan to "Connect w vetted community-contributed/connected graphics to platforms" and "Integrate corpus into larger existing service" are vague.  The budgeting is detailed and seems to have been well-researched with specific figures, however from my experience in projects the other parts of the plan may need to be made to match this level of detail to increase likelihood of success.  Given the evidence, I estimate a moderate likelihood of successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: A suitable timeline is given for delivering elements of the project.  However, there are no KPIs given and the objectives are too in-specific/vague to infer these eg "Connect initial Corpus to platforms" - which and how many platforms? What is the planned adoption? A measure of what "success" would look is not offered, nor are any numerical metrics by which to assess the project, or any kind of plan of how the proposer would inform the community of progress, or compare against other (eg text-based) solutions.  Given this, I feel the evidence is insufficient for the community to be able to easily audit the progress and success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: The assessor may be offering their assessment from a biased perspective. For example in the AUDITABILITY section the rationale acknowledges that a suitable timetable is given but ignores the clarity of the problem statement and the plan outlined to address the problem. Instead noting a lack of KPIs and rating the entire subsection as a 1. Thus the bias appears to be for KPIs and the Assessor unduly rates the subsection.

f6_assessments.q0: This is certainly an interesting proposal and I feel there may well be a positive aspect that such a proposal may add value to the Cardano community. I just cannot see the path via this proposal at present to voters being convinced of its merits. The proposer needs to include practical examples of how the idea would work in addition to the theoretical content.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the information provided it is not really possible to fully gauge the experience and knowledge of the proposer. The plan does provide some clues to the proposers skillset but cannot be confirmed. The proposal would greatly benefit by some examples of the authors previous work. Without these the likely success of implementation could be established.
f6_assessments.q2: A reasonable effort at providing a budget which may well be a valid depiction of how resources would be utilised but lacks auditability without examples of work undertaken or even examples of other similiar projects produced by others. The catalyst community needs further explanation of this project to be able to vote with confidence on why it will benefit the Cardano ecosystem. Highly recommend seeking out collaborations within the Catalyst community to further this project.
f6_assessments.reply: The assessor confuses categories, acknowledging the presense of a budget in AUDITABILITY but not in FEASIBILITY. Neither does the assessor mention the timetable or detailed plan in the FEASIBILITY. Furthermore the assessor may not have read or ignored the full proposal as the description of the problem and solution contained in the proposal --including the "Ingestion, Evaluation, and Translation" section of the plan that clearly involves members of the Cardano community in the proposal. Yet the section is scored 2.

f6_assessments.q0: Using pictures instead of words for translation purposes is an amazing idea and was executed really well. The proposer had goals, a timeline, they explained the budget and had a strong set of reasons to support their ideas.
f6_assessments.q1: It is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully because they have detailed timeline of when and how they will get things done. They also have a well-written plan explaining that they want to use graphics to show information and only translate the captions as there are lots of different languages. They also have lots of experience in this area.
f6_assessments.q2: Since there is a timeline and plan as well as a set of goals it is easy to audit their progress and when they will reach the success of creating graphic information sources.
